critique: The document is an approval of a Code of Fair Competition for the Millinery Industry. The tone is formal and legalistic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and stability in the industry. There is a sense of joy that the industry is being regulated and that fair competition is being ensured. There is a sense of sadness that some members of the industry may experience hardship. There is no anger, fear, disgust, or surprise conveyed in the document.
